contextId.information: In prophecy things that will happen in the future are often referred to as if they had already happened. This emphasizes that the prophecy will certainly come true. AT: "enemies from other countries will take my people, Israel, as slaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pastforfuture]])
contextId.quote: my people have gone into captivity

contextId.information: The prophet speaks of the future as if it had already happened. He does this to insist that the prophecy certainly will come about. AT: "he will punish them with his powerful hand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pastforfuture]])
contextId.quote: He has reached out with his hand against them and has punished them

contextId.information: Isaiah speaks of these future events as though they have already happened. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pastforfuture]])
contextId.quote: has come ... has passed ... has stored ... have crossed ... lodge ... trembles ... has fled
